definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
the five emphases, four beauties and three loves (PRC policy introduced in 1981, including emphasis on manners, beauty of language and love of socialism)
pinyin: wu3 jiang3 si4 mei3 san1 re4 ai4

sentences.english: "Before it happened I loved school, I loved everything about it, " Redding , now 19, said on CNN television.
sentences.chinese: 這事發生之前，我熱愛學校，熱愛這裏的一切。

sentences.english: "Before it happened I loved school, I loved everything about it, " Redding , now 19, said on CNN television.
sentences.chinese: 這事發生之前，我熱愛學校，熱愛這裏的一切。

sentences.english: China's love for towering skyscrapers just got turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 中國對摩天大樓的熱愛一百八十度大轉彎。

sentences.english: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language. -W. H.
sentences.chinese: 一個詩人，首先應當是一個非常熱愛語言的人。

sentences.english: Since childhood love of art, hard-working people, self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 自幼熱愛美術，勤奮過人，自學成材。

sentences.english: He loves work; he is always the first to come and the last to leave.
sentences.chinese: 他熱愛工作，總是第一個來，最後一個走。

sentences.english: Luxun had deep love for artistic works all his life, especially in woodcut of block print.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅先生一生熱愛美術作品，對版畫中木刻興趣尤甚。

sentences.english: Summer signing Chris Smalling says he's enjoyed every minute of life so far as a Manchester United player.
sentences.chinese: 夏季簽約的斯馬林說自己熱愛在曼聯的每一分鐘。

sentences.english: My friends, it is time to take back the country we love.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友們，是時候拿回我們熱愛的國家了。

sentences.english: Add to that the costs associated with a moderate involvement with those newly prioritized activities that you truly love.
sentences.chinese: 然後加上適量參加重新排選過你所熱愛的活動的費用。

sentences.english: They love freedom and pledge their lives for their love.
sentences.chinese: 他們熱愛自由，願爲他們的所愛拋頭顱灑熱血。

sentences.english: It is devotion tinged with intellectual knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 帶有智性知識的熱愛會變得淡色。

sentences.english: As a boy, Cousteau loved the coral reefs in the sea.
sentences.chinese: 小的時侯，庫克斯熱愛家附近的海里的珊瑚礁。

sentences.english: Therefore his love of work is an escape from life.
sentences.chinese: 因此，熱愛工作變成逃避生活。

sentences.english: If you love life, think carpe diem.
sentences.chinese: 假如你熱愛生命，就想想及時行樂這句話。

sentences.english: We love the sea, yet we pollute it.
sentences.chinese: 我們熱愛大海，然而我們卻污染了它。

definition: to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
interest (desire to know about sth)/interest (thing in which one is interested)/hobby/CL:個|个[ge4]
to like/to take pleasure in/keen on/fond of/interest/hobby/appetite for/CL:個|个[ge4]
to focus/to concentrate/to give one's full attention
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
